answerText: nematode or nematoda[10] Nematodes contain a pseudo- version of this central body cavity, which originally arose in triploblastic animals but was subsequently mutated out in many lines. It is usually present in the mesoderm.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 6 | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: C. elegans is a member of this phylum, marine examples of which often have renette glands to secrete salt. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this phylum of invertebrates, commonly known as roundworms. The Mesorhabditis genus of these organisms do not actually fuse eggs and sperm at fertilization.
